sen.j: 摂丹街道（せったんかいどう）は、摂津国と丹波国（現在の大阪府池田市 - 京都府亀岡市）を結ぶ街道。
sen.e: The Settan-kaido Road is the principal road connecting between Settsu Province and Tanba Province. (today's Ikeda City, Osaka Prefecture and Kameoka City, Kyoto Prefecture)
The Settan-kaido Road was the principal road connecting Settsu Province and Tanba Province (present-day Ikeda City, Osaka Prefecture, and Kameoka City, Kyoto Prefecture, respectively).
The Settan-kaido Road was the principal road connecting Settsu Province and Tanba Province (present-day Ikeda City, Osaka Prefecture, and Kameoka City, Kyoto Prefecture, respectively).

sen.j: 摂津国・能勢郡側は余野までは余野街道、丹波国側は池田街道の別名がある。
sen.e: This road has alternative names called Yono-kaido Road for the section of the road in Nose District, Settsu Province, while the section in Tanba Province is called Ikeda-kaido Road.
The section of the road in Nose District, Settsu Province, was also called Yono-kaido Road, while the section in Tanba Province was also called Ikeda-kaido Road.
The section of the road in Nose District, Settsu Province, was also called Yono-kaido Road, while the section in Tanba Province was also called Ikeda-kaido Road.

sen.j: 近代以前は「池田道」「亀岡道」などと呼ばれた。
sen.e: Earlier than the modern days, those roads used to be called "Ikeda-do Road" and "Kameoka-do Road."
Until modern times, these roads were called 'Ikeda-do Road' and 'Kameoka-do Road,' respectively.
sen.cmt: word flow原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。
sen.e: Until modern times, these roads were called 'Ikeda-do Road' and 'Kameoka-do Road,' respectively.

sen.j: ほとんどの区間が道路拡張工事などで整備され、旧街道の面影はほとんど残っていない。
sen.e: Most of the section of this road has been re-developed by expansion construction for the road width, replacing or reducing the atmosphere of the old-days road and the roadside scenery.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Most of the section of this road has been re-developed by expansion construction for the road width, replacing or reducing the atmosphere of the old-days road and the roadside scenery.
Most of the section of this road has been re-developed by expansion construction for the road width, replacing or reducing the atmosphere of the old-days road and the roadside scenery.

sen.j: 沿線の所々に残されている道標がかつての旧街道の面影となっている。
sen.e: Only some signposts remained on the roadside indicate the past image and atmosphere of the old-days road.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Only some signposts remained on the roadside indicate the past image and atmosphere of the old-days road.
Only some signposts remained on the roadside indicate the past image and atmosphere of the old-days road.

sen.j: 大阪府・京都府境の街道脇に昭和9年に京都府が設置した府境標が残っている。
sen.e: The prefecture boundary mark placed by Kyoto Prefecture in 1934 still remains on the roadside at the boarder of Osaka Prefecture and Kyoto Prefecture.
The prefecture boundary mark placed by Kyoto Prefecture in 1934 still remains on the roadside at the boarder of Osaka Prefecture and Kyoto Prefecture.
The prefecture boundary mark placed by Kyoto Prefecture in 1934 still remains on the roadside at the boarder of Osaka Prefecture and Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 区間の大半が国道423号に指定されており、亀岡市内においては国道372号の一部区間が含まれる。
sen.e: Most of the section of this road is designated as the National Highway No. 423, while some section in Kameoka City is designated as the National Highway No. 372.
Most of the section of this road is designated as the National Highway No. 423, while some section in Kameoka City is designated as the National Highway No. 372.
Most of the section of this road is designated as the National Highway No. 423, while some section in Kameoka City is designated as the National Highway No. 372.

sen.j: 終点：京都府亀岡市安町 （旧山陰道（京都府道402号王子並河線）交点）
